data: Nurse to Initiate Surgeon Immediate Post Operative phase. These orders continue on the Inpatient Unit
Discontinue VASC Pre Operative (Day of Surgery) PowerPlan
Assess neurovascular status lower extremity, q1h for 4 hour, then q4h for 24 hour, then QID if satisfactory
Check right groin q15 min for 1 hour, then q30 min for 1 hour, then q1h for 4 hours, then QID
Check left groin q15 min for 1 hour, then q30 min for 1 hour, then q1h for 4 hours, then QID
Assess right leg q15min for 1 hour, then q30min for 1 hour, then q1h for 4 hours, then QID
Assess left leg q15min for 1 hour, then q30min for 1 hour, then q1h for 4 hours, then QID
Assess right arm q15min for 1 hour, then q30min for 1 hour, then q1h for 4 hours, then QID
Assess left arm q15min for 1 hour, then q30min for 1 hour, then q1h for 4 hours, then QID
q30min for 1 hour, then q1h for 4 hour then BID. Start on arrival to recovery room
Bilateral pedal pulse assessment q30min for 1 hour, then q1h for 4 hour then BID. Start on arrival to recovery room
q1h, for 24 hour, then q6h if stable
q4h, for 24 hour, then qshift if stable
q1h, call physician when ACT less then 150 (for sheath removal)
Leave dressing for 48 hours unless otherwise ordered
for 24 hour, then supervised activity as tolerated
for 24 hour, then non-weight bearing _____ limb
for _____ hour keep right leg straight
for _____ hour keep left leg straight
order rate: 2 mL/kg/h, IV, order duration: 6 hour, drug form: bag
300 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with penicillin allergy, including anaphylaxis. Do NOT administer if severe delayed skin reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis)
1,000 mg, IV, q8h, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: bag
2,000 mg, IV, q8h, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: bag
1,000 mg, IV, q12h, order duration: 24 hour
1,500 mg, IV, q12h, order duration: 24 hour
For high risk patients (groin surgery in diabetics; morbidly obese; re-operative procedures; active peripheral infection; gangrene of either limb), ADD:
500 mg, IV, q12h, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: bag
500 mg, PO, q12h, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: tab

q1h for 4h, then q4h if stable for 24 hour, then vitals QID when stable
